TopicTitle: Why do people keep on hopping in the IRC, saying at most "hi", and then leaving 30s to 2 minutes later?

Articles.Content: We can't do anything if you don't contribute
I think people don't know what the IRC chat is. They probably click on, and then do what you described above. Then they just leave because they don't know what's going on.
They may be waiting for a response showing that someone is there before asking their real question. IRC doesn't make it easy to tell whether everyone is idle.

19 hours ago, HebaruSan said:

They may be waiting for a response showing that someone is there before asking their real question. IRC doesn't make it easy to tell whether everyone is idle.

I guess, but putting an extra barrier to asking their question still seems silly.

Could also be sleep mode/data saving on a device. I know that one price of equipment that I had would kill the WiFi when it went to sleep. Rather annoying as I did want to actively watch the IRC channels that i was in.
